column2: ENGLISH
I should ask [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] to grant me a title.
Today, my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] asked me for a fief of [From.GetPossPronoun] own to govern...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] promised me a title!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] refused to grant me a title!
'You are not ready yet...' was [From.GetTitledFirstName] excuse to refuse grant me a title!
[Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] must have forgotten [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] promised [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] would grant me a title.
My [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] is reminding me of my promise to grant [From.GetObjectPronoun] a fiefdom again...
I asked [From.GetTitledFirstName] once again for a fiefdom but [From.GetTitledFirstName] refused to give me a title!

[From.GetBestName] - a disgruntled noble from the court of [From.Liege.GetTitledName] - has appeared in my realm, furious that [From.GetPossPronoun] [FromScope.GetLiegeRelation] would deny [From.GetObjectPronoun] a title of [From.GetPossPronoun] own. [From.GetTitledFirstName] intends to raise an army and take the [From.Liege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] by force!

[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] is so furious over my refusal to grant [FromFrom.GetObjectPronoun] a title that [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] has left the realm for the court of [From.GetTitledName], letting it be known that [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] is hiring troops to take what is 'rightfully' [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] by force of arms!
It is time for me to get married, or at least betrothed to a suitable match!
My beloved [target_relative.GetRootRelation] [target_relative.GetFirstName] is concerned that [target_relative.GetSubjectPronoun] is still not married.
My [GetFromRelation] has promised to arrange a marriage for me!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] had forgotten [From.GetHerHis] promise, and told me [From.GetSheHe] would not help me find a suitable spouse!
I am still not married nor betrothed! Surely [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] has not forgotten about [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] promise to find me a suitable spouse?
[From.GetFirstName], my dear [GetFromRelation], clearly upset, is reminding me of my promise to get [From.GetObjectPronoun] married.
An arranged marriage has been denied me, I will find me a wife without help!
An arranged marriage has been denied me, I will find me a husband without help!
My hopeless [GetFromRelation] has betrayed me and secretly gotten married to a lady-in-waiting.
My hopeless [GetFromRelation] has betrayed me and secretly gotten married to a servant.
Please?
I promised to arrange it
It had better not be hollow words...
This will not stand!
I'll ask again later...
Ask [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] again
Oh, very well!
This is an outrage!
I guess I can allow that...
The traitorous git!
I shall ask [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] for a suitable spouse!
I will find [target_relative.GetObjectPronoun] someone nice!
I must remind [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] about [Root.GetHerHis] promise!
I'm getting married right now!
I have just the person in mind!
Ah well, I wish them luck!
I told [From.GetObjectPronoun] [From.GetSubjectPronoun] is not ready
Not again!
I've had it with [From.GetPossPronoun] whining!
I WILL have what is mine!
And here I was hoping [target_relative.GetSubjectPronoun]'d take the vows...
That's it, you're off to the monastery!
The insolence! I will not forget this...
I mentioned a Church career...
I still have not found anyone suitable...
Long life to them... in the oubliette!
Diplomatically refuse
You are already married, remember? To [From.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName]?
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] asks [This.GetTitledFirstName] for a title
[This.GetFirstName] will expect a title soon
[This.GetFirstName] is angry with me
[This.GetFirstName] is disappointed
[This.GetTitledFirstName] is asked once again to grant [Root.GetTitledFirstName] a title.
[This.GetFirstName] won't like this...
[This.GetTitledFirstName] is asked to find a spouse for [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
[This.GetSubjectPronounCap] is delighted with my promise!
[This.GetSubjectPronounCap] storms out of the room.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] is reminded about [This.GetHerHis] promise about finding a suitable spouse for [Root.GetTitledFirstName]
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] gets married without [This.GetTitledFirstName]'s consent

You are bent low over your [Root.GetEducationTool], struggling to stay focused and to keep your eyes open, when your [target_spouse.GetHusbandWife] [target_spouse.GetTitledFirstName] enters. [target_spouse.GetSheHeCap] crosses the room and inspects the [Root.GetEducationTool] over your shoulder. "Perhaps a fresh pair of eyes might prove helpful, dear [Root.GetHusbandWife]?"

Your [target_spouse.GetHusbandWife] has received an education in [target_spouse.GetEducationSubject], like yourself, so [target_spouse.GetSheHe] quickly grasps the nuances of the problem as you explain it. The two of you set to work, discussing and comparing [Root.GetEducationalTopicPlural]. [target_spouse.GetFirstName] is a most competent [target_spouse.GetEducationRole]! Within the hour, you have laid the groundwork for a promising solution.
Perhaps you are right, [target_spouse.GetFirstName].
Accept §Y[target_spouse.GetTitledFirstName]§!'s offer to help.\n
A brilliant idea, [target_spouse.GetFirstName]! Have you any additional suggestions?
Finish your work with the help of §Y[target_spouse.GetTitledFirstName]§!.\n
You don't think I can handle this on my own?
Refuse §Y[target_spouse.GetTitledFirstName]§!'s offer to help.\n
Let us retire to the bedchamber, my dear...
Leave your work for now and spend some quality time with §Y[target_spouse.GetTitledFirstName]§!...\n
